intro: Echinopsis hamatacantha, commonly known as the spiked moon cactus, is a species of cactus native to South America. It is characterized by its spherical shape and prominent, spiny areoles that bear white to pale blue spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the warmer months, typically in spring or summer. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for succulent collectors and desert gardens.
